item.description:
Join us for our regular monthly meeting to celebrate Charles Darwin's 200th birthday and the 150th anniversary of the publication of "Origin of Species". If you already planned on coming to this event, please note that the start time has changed to 6:30 PM. At 6:45 we plan to have a toast and birthday cake. This will be followed by our speaker at 7:00 PM.

Our guest, Jane Crooks will be giving a talk on the basics of what Darwin's evolution is and how it works. She will cover such topics as: What observations and information prompted Darwin to devise the mechanism of natural selection to explain how organisms change? What is natural selection? How does evolution affect our lives? Learn the basics of Darwin's studies, especially how natural selection works.

Speaker: Jane Crooks holds a B.S. in Biology and MA in Secondary Education from Tufts University, and she completed graduate work in Bacterial Genetics at Boston University. She taught high school and middle school science for 23 year and currently tutors privately.
item.how_to_find_us: Park in the lot. Through the double doors, hang a right.
item.name: GWH MEETING - February 2009 - Evolution made simple
